numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a difference between two groups of students.
2. One group of students has more wealth.
3. This group of students has a family legacy.
4. Another group of students does not have wealth.
5. This group of students does not have a family legacy.
6. Students with more wealth and a family legacy have a higher chance of admission to an Ivy League school than students without wealth and without a family legacy.
7. The right side of the graph shows evidence for this claim.
8. The graph says that a richer legacy student is 7 times as likely to be admitted as a non-rich non-legacy student.
9. I wonder why students with wealth and a family legacy are more likely to be admitted to an Ivy League school.
10. I wonder why students without wealth and without a family legacy are less likely to be admitted to an Ivy League school.
11. I live in a low-middle-class area.
12. This fact relates to me and my community.
13. The chance that kids in my area go to an Ivy League school is very low.
14. I think that this situation is unfair.
15. Some people want to attend a good college.
16. Some people want to be successful.
17. The headline is: Ivy Leagues for the rich only?
